Value.label: Beeper
Value.Help: Enable or disable the keypad beeper.

Value.label: Vacation Mode
Value.Help: Enable or disable vacation mode. Disables all user codes, preventing all codes from unlocking the deadbolt. Enable for extra security while you are away for an extended period of time.

Value.label: Lock and Leave Mode
Value.Help: Enable or disable Lock and Leave Mode. When enabled: Press the Schlage button on the keypad to lock the deadbolt (Default setting). When disabled: Press the Schlage button on the keypad and then enter a user code to lock the deadbolt.

Value.label: Lock Alarm Mode
Value.Help:
By default the alarm is turned off by default. After intalling, you can turn the alarm on.
Alert Alarms when the door opens or closes. Perfect for monitoring the door while you are home. After the alarm is triggered, there is a built-in 3-second delay for it to reset. sounds two short beeps.
Tamper Alarms when the lock is disturbed while locked. Senses subtle activity at the lock. Sounds 15 second alarm (90 dB).
Forced Entry Alarms when significant force pushes against the door while locked. Perfect for nighttime or when you are away from home. Least sensitive mode. Sounds 3-minute shrill, steady alarm (90dB).

Value.label: Alarm Alert Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of 3. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Alarm Tamper Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of 3. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Alarm Forced Entry Sensitivity
Value.Help: Each alarm mode is preset to a sensitivity level of 3. If your alarm is sounding too frequently, or not frequently enough, try changing this setting. If you change the alarm mode, the sensitivity will revert back to the default setting.

Value.label: Disable Local Alarm Controls
Value.Help: This configuration setting controls the ability to ENABLE or DISABLE local control of the built-in alarm function.

Value.label: Electronic transition count
Value.Help: Indicates the number of transitions from locked to unlocked or unlocked to locked state via electronic activation.

Value.label: Mechanical transition count
Value.Help: Indicates the number of transitions from locked to unlocked or unlocked to locked state via mechanical activation.

Value.label: Electronic failed count
Value.Help: Indicates the number of failed electronic activation attempts for this lock.

Value.label: Auto Lock
Value.Help: When enabled, the lock will automatically relock 30 seconds after unlocking. (Disabled by default.)

Value.label: User code legnth
Value.Help: Choose user code length between 4 and 8 digits. IMPORTANT: All user codes must be the same length.

Value.label: Electrical High Preload Transition Count
Value.Help: Indicates the number of transitions from locked to unlocked or unlocked to locked state via electronic activation that indicated a high preload on the deadbolt. This is a subset of Electronic transition count. High preload occurs when the bolt is obstructed and the motor needs to use more power to throw the bolt. Adjust door and strike plate to ensure the bolt can move freely. This will save battery power.

Value.label: Bootloader Version
Value.Help: The version of the bootloader in the lock.
